Package org.rapidcontext.core.data

Class PropertiesSerializer

java.lang.Object
org.rapidcontext.core.data.PropertiesSerializer
public class PropertiesSerializer extends Object
A dictionary serializer and unserializer for the standard Java properties file format. The dictionary mapping to the properties format is not exact, and may omit serialization of data in some cases. The following basic requirements must be met in order to serialize a dictionary into a properties file:
  • No circular references are permitted.
  • String, Integer, Boolean, Array and Dict objects are supported.
  • Other object types are converted to strings with toString().
  • Property key names must consist only of printable ISO-8859-1 character, without any spaces or dots.
  • Property key names should never consist of only numeric characters, since they will then be confused with array indices.
  • Array null values will be omitted, renumbering the remaining indices.
The structure and order of dictionary objects will be kept, using the file order in the properties file and dot-notation for property names.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Per Cederberg

  • Method Details

    • serialize

      public static String serialize(Object obj) throws IOException
      Serializes an object into an properties representation. The string returned can be used as a properties.
      Parameters:
      obj - the object to convert, or null
      Returns:
      an properties file representation
      Throws:
      IOException - if the data couldn't be serialized

    • read

      public static Dict read(File file) throws FileNotFoundException, IOException
      Reads a file containing properties and returns the contents in a dictionary. The property names from the file are normally preserved, except for structural interpretation. Dot ('.') characters in names are interpreted as sub-object separators, and numbers are interpreted as an array indices. The dictionary values are stored as booleans, integers or strings.
      Parameters:
      file - the file to load
      Returns:
      the dictionary read from the file
      Throws:
      FileNotFoundException - if the file couldn't be found
      IOException - if an error occurred while reading the file

    • read

      public static Dict read(ZipFile zip, ZipEntry entry) throws IOException
      Reads a ZIP file entry containing properties and returns the contents in a dictionary. The property names from the file are normally preserved, except for structural interpretation. Dot ('.') characters in names are interpreted as sub-object separators, and numbers are interpreted as an array indices. The dictionary values are stored as booleans, integers or strings.
      Parameters:
      zip - the ZIP file
      entry - the ZIP file entry to load
      Returns:
      the dictionary read from the file
      Throws:
      IOException - if an error occurred while reading the file

    • write

      public static void write(File file, Dict dict) throws IOException
      Writes the contents of a dictionary into a properties file. The key names from the dictionary are preserved, but contained array indices will be renumbered from zero while omitting null values. Contained dictionary or array values will be written recursively by appending dot ('.') characters between each element. All other values are stored as strings.
      Parameters:
      file - the file to save
      dict - the dictionary object
      Throws:
      IOException - if an error occurred while writing the file

    • toProperties

      public static Properties toProperties(Dict dict)
      Converts a dictionary into a properties object. The key names from the dictionary are preserved, but contained array indices will be renumbered from zero while omitting null values. Contained dictionary or array values will be written recursively by appending dot ('.') characters between each element. All other values are stored as strings.
      Parameters:
      dict - the dictionary object
      Returns:
      the properties object with all the data
